Description: The Rest on the Flight into Egypt; night scene with the Holy Family seated by a fire under a makeshift shelter at right, shepherds with their animals at left, a boy putting wood on the fire at centre, a building on a hill in background, a pond in foreground; after Rembrandt. 1752 Etching and engraving
Curator's comments: After the 1647 painting by Rembrandt in the National Gallery of Ireland, Dublin (Bredius 576). The plate was commissioned and published by Arthur Pond. He paid 14s for the copper plate in July 1749.
Bibliographic references: Corpus of Rembrandt Paintings 1982-2005 / A Corpus of Rembrandt Paintings
